verbose_text: We show that the PrE and epiblast genes are enriched for bivalent chromatin domains in the E3.5 ICM, with late (i.e., lineage specific) genes having relatively higher levels of H3K27me3, suggesting that a changing ratio of H3K4me3 to H3K27me3 may in part be responsible for the transition from noisy to lineage resolved expression.
